events.name: Monkey Mission Mars: Fourth Horizon w/ Xamarin
events.description: Build your skills, find the crew, save the mission. This free technical training event lets you experience all the latest Microsoft development tools in an exciting, challenge-packed day of puzzles. Earth’s first mission to Mars hangs in jeopardy. Only the brightest minds, and the sharpest tools can recover the crew and get humanity’s progress back on track. Will you answer the call? Sign up, and save the mission with Microsoft. Agenda 6:15 PM Registration & Traditional Developer Food & Setup6:45 PM - 7:45 PM Exercise 1: Establish a connection using Azure IoT Hub7:45 PM – 09:15 PM Exercise 2: Remote monitoring using Azure Functions Who should attend? This event is for developers who want hands on experience to effectively combine three cloud technologies that will make your next project great. Previous experience with cloud technologies is beneficial, but not essential. Before you attend This is an interactive workshop. To get the most from your session, please bring your laptop and power supply. In addition: Activate your Azure account and bring your Microsoft account credentials. Don't have a Microsoft account? Sign up nowActivate a free 30-day trial Microsoft Azure accountIf you subscribe to Visual Studio Subscriptions, activate your free Azure benefit. Install Visual Studio Code or Visual Studio 2017 Community, Professional, or Enterprise
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: GovTech Talks: Agile Quality Practices & Tools
events.description: Hey cool people! :) We have another guest talk by Wendy from GDS@GovTech, and followed by Open Space discussion. Agenda • 18:45 Networking and food • 19:30 Talk "Agile Quality Practices & Tools" • 20:15 Open Space discussion Agile Quality Practices & Tools - Wendy In the previous meetup, Wendy shared Agile engineering practices. Now, that you have a better appreciation for quality, the next question she will answer is the why, how and what GDS does to achieve quality. This talk focuses on how to leverage quality engineering to accelerate product development. Topics include • Zero Defects • CI/CD pipeline • Test Automation AOB: Drivers may park their cars at Pixel Studio (limited lots), Galaxis or Fusionopolis.
events.location: PIXEL Studios (Level 2), 10, central green exchange, Singapore

events.name: June Meetup (RDRC Edition)
events.description:
Hi fellow Rubyists! Come join us for our June Ruby meetup at Spacemob, 8 Claymore Hill, #03-01, Singapore 229572 This meetup is organised in conjunction with RedDotRubyConf 2017 as a fringe event. Get a chance to meet Matz, Aaron Patterson, and many more speakers and Ruby developers! Grab your tickets here! -------------- Meetup Programme 1. "To ORM, or not to ORM", by Mykola Kyryk of PocketMath 2. "Publishing your first gem", by Peter Hoeg 3. Discussion: "Confess your MongoDB opinions" by Emily Stolfo, MongoDB Inc and maintainer of Mongoid gem (details at bottom of page) 4. Announcements   - This is a 5 to 10-minute session, during which anyone can stand up and share something interesting! - Some sharing on "Nexmo international SMS and Voice API + Ruby gem", by Chris Guzman of Nexmo - Is your company looking to hire Ruby developers? Please share with us! -------------- Interested to give a talk at future meetups? You could share about your startup technology stack, your new RubyGem, your opinions on best practices, or projects you discovered or are working on. And we are especially friendly towards beginners! See you all soon! --------------  Thank you Sponsors! Venue  In Conjunction with  


Video Recording Many thanks to @engineersftw for video coverage!  


--------------  Organisers Mingding  (@hanmd82  / hanmd82@gmail.com)Guo Xiang (@tgx_world  / tgx_world@hotmail.com)Winston  (@winstonyw / winstonyw@gmail.com) --- Discussion Topic "Confess your MongoDB opinions" by Emily Stolfo "As the maintainer of Mongoid, the ActiveRecord replacement for using MongoDB with Rails, I'm aware that MongoDB isn't the first database choice of Rails users. I'd like to find out what I can do to help developers more often choose to use MongoDB with Rails. Can I build tools to help you migrate data? Can I provide a connector that allows you to convert SQL queries to MongoDB queries? Should I make the query DSL totally different from that of ActiveRecord and more similar to MongoDB's JSON-like query language? I invite you to openly confess your MongoDB opinions to help me provide better support for the Rails community in this brief two-way presentation."

events.name: talk.js - June
events.description: This is talk.js -- a monthly meet up for all things JavaScript, Node.js, and the modern web. Watch our past talks at Engineers.SG. Want to speak at talk.js? Propose your talk here. Agenda 7.00pm: Doors open - mingle with pizzas and drinks 7.30pm: Opening address by host 7.40pm: Start of scheduled talks 8.45pm: Open announcements 9.00pm: End of event Scheduled talks See the updated list of scheduled talks here. Open announcements An open announcement is when anyone can make an announcement about a new meet up, job opportunities, upcoming events, or something you've learnt. If you have a short announcement you'd like to share with the audience, you may do so during the open announcements segment. Important Remember to bring a photo ID to get through building security (e.g. driver's license, passport, etc.) Sponsor(s) Venue sponsor: PayPal Food and drink sponsor: PayPal
events.location: PayPal Singapore, Suntec Tower 5, 5 Temasek Boulevard #09-01

events.name: ProductTank #10: Innovation and ideation
events.description:
Speaker: Scott Bales, Managing Director / Innovation Labs Asia Talk: Innovation and Ideation  How do companies stay competitive and disrupt themselves? Customers need to be part of that innovation journey so they get exactly what they want and pay for the product.  About Scott A leading digital & innovation executive & evangelist, Scott Bales is a global futurist, innovation & digital strategist, serial entrepreneur, keynote speaker at TEDx and author of the best-selling book, Mobile Ready: Connecting With The Untethered Consumer, a leading mobile strategy read.  Scott has lead market expansion and innovation capability development with organisations desiring stronger presence in consumer internet markets, and driven high growth for early-stage companies. Worked with mobile operators to drive new mobile location-based ecosystems, including mobile money. And recent crafting strategies to engage the mobile social generation. AGENDA 18:30 - Registration starts. 19:00 - Registration ends. 19:00 - Quick intro about ProductTank & a few words from the host. 19:05 - 19:35 - Speaker talk + Q&A 19:35 - 21:00 - Networking 21:00 - Event ends Notes: • The exact schedule is subject to change, but we’ll definitely start by 7pm • Remember to bring your ID, just in case :) • IMPORTANT: Please be on time. Registration will close at 7pm, and in case you're late, you won't be able to enter until the break 


About location Carousell have kindly offered to host this meetup, their address is: 240 Tanjong Pagar Road, Singapore,[masked]
events.location: Carousell HQ, 240 Tanjong Pagar Rd, Singapore 088540

events.name: Bracelet Making Workshop
events.description:
Learn braiding and knotting techniques using cords to create your own Stackable Bracelets from a mix of colourful cords and beads to choose from, with our very own craft enthusiast - Felicia Ow.

Click on link to find out more and Sign Up! Limited slots available!
events.location: National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, Singapore 188969
